article.headline: Pepperdine 78, Colorado 72
article.story: BOULDER, Colo. (AP) -- Pepperdine has faced more than its share of adversity this year under first-year coach Vance Walberg. Down to 10 available players, it didn't matter Monday night to a team that broke its four-game losing streak with a 78-72 win over Colorado. "I'm down to eight scholarship players and we lost three starters last week," Walberg said. "My son (Jason) tore his ACL and my starting point guard and center both quit, but that hasn't taken the fight out of this team. Chase Griffin had 18 points and nine rebounds and Marvin Lea scored all of his 17 points in the second half to lead gritty Pepperdine to its win. "We aren't ever going to quit," the Pepperdine coach said. "If we quit it's my fault." Lea scored nine of his points from the free throw line as Pepperdine (2-6) ended a four-game losing streak. Tomas Pranchiliauskas scored 15 points on five 3-pointers. Richard Roby had a season-high 32 points for Colorado (3-5), while Xavier Silas had 19 points and Dominique Coleman had his first career double-double with 12 points and 10 rebounds. "It's tough to win games with 21 turnovers," Colorado coach Ricardo Patton said. "I don't think we've come together as a team." Kingsley Costain gave Pepperdine its first lead, 41-38, with a 3-pointer three minutes into the second half and moments later 3-pointers by Costain and Gregg Barlow extended it to 47-41. Colorado, which had only Roby's 3-pointer and six field goals in the first 10 minutes of the second half, was behind 59-51 when Roby's two free throws began an 11-4 run that cut it to 63-62 with 5:24 remaining. But the Buffaloes failed to score on their next five possessions and Chase Griffin's 3-pointer keyed a mini 5-0 run to make it 69-62. Roby closed the gap to 74-69 with a 3-pointer with 26 seconds left. Costain and Lea sealed the game with two free throws each. "We just wore them out," Griffin said. "There isn't much offense until we get to halfcourt and then you push the ball and see what happens." Colorado had everything going its way in the early going. Roby had five points before Pepperdine attempted a shot and the Buffaloes had a 25-17 lead after Coleman's 3-pointer with 12:14. But the uptempo style began wearing Colorado down in the final 11 minutes of the half. Two 3-pointers by Pranchiliauskas got Pepperdine to within 25-23 with 10:58 left. Even though Pepperdine connected on only 3-of-17 shots the rest of the half and trailed 35-31 at halftime, the Buffaloes looked tired when they walked off the court at intermission. "It's hard for us to go through this," Silas said of Colorado's early season woes. "Every time our offense is clicking, our defense has a hard time. We've got to put everything together."

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
